title: Type Shopping
content:
**Recently, I went on a complete shopping spree for type.**

The two online destinations that I kept coming back to were [Village](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.vllg.com/) and [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.fountain.nu/), due to their pricing, tight selection, usability and general value. H&FJ is, of course, great, but I feel like I have memorized their entire catalog already and they're a little pricey.

Does anyone know of anything new and comparable that I am unaware of? The huge sources (FontShop, Veer, Linotype, etc.) tend to overwhelm and are difficult to shop.

Any suggestions?

Thanks,

Sam

PS Some other close runner ups included: Dalton Maag, Emigre, House Industries, Typotheque, Underware, and OurType.

\* I ended up buying Omnes, Apex Sans and Pill Gothic, if anyone was interested.
author: Sam Serif

comments.content:
Two I can think of:

[Joshua Darden](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.joshuadarden.com/)  
 [Adriane](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typefolio/adriane-text/) by Typefolio has a nice italic.

I love Village and Fountain. I also like [Psyops](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.psyops.com/html/home.html) and [Type-O-Tones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/). I also would like more from [Shinn Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/shinntype.com/). I am looking forward to Figgins and Scotch Modern being released.

Sharon

All smaller sources, but goodies: [DSType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/dstype.com/main.htm), [Kimera Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/kimeratype.com/), [LucasFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/index_neu.html), [MAC Rhino](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.macrhino.com/), [Parachute](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.parachute.gr/), [Process Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/processtypefoundry.com/), [Stone Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/stonetypefoundry.com/), [Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/sudtipos.com/home), and, of course, [Schwartzco](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/christianschwartz.com/).

Hi Sam,

It sounds like your typographic tastes are well covered above but if you're interested in a little more display variety and generally quick shopping, I invite you to visit the [Font Bros](http://web.archive.org/web/20150122201742/http:/www.fontbros.com/).

Best,  
Stuart :D
